intro: Teucrium commune proles rouyanum, commonly known as Rouyan germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small, clustered in whorls, and range in color from pink to purple, blooming in summer. It prefers well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sunny habitats.
